content_old: 1 And it shall be､ if thou wilt hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to observe to do all his commandments which I am commanding thee､ to-day then will Yahweh thy God set thee on high, above all the nations of the earth;

content: 2 and all these blessings shall come in upon thee､ and reach thee,—because thou dost hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God:—
content_old: 2 and all these blessings shall come in upon thee､ and reach thee,—because thou dost hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God:—

content: 3 Blessed shalt thou be in the city,—and blessed shalt thou be in the field:
content_old: 3 Blessed shalt thou be in the city,—and blessed shalt thou be in the field:

content: 4 Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body､ and the fruit of thy ground､ and the fruit of thy cattle,—the young of thy kine､ and the ewes of thy flock:
content_old: 4 Blessed shall be the fruit of thy body､ and the fruit of thy ground､ and the fruit of thy cattle,—the young of thy kine､ and the ewes of thy flock:

content: 5 Blessed shall be thy basket､ and thy kneading-trough:
content_old: 5 Blessed shall be thy basket､ and thy kneading-trough:

content: 6 Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in,—and blessed shalt thou be when thou goest out:
content_old: 6 Blessed shalt thou be when thou comest in,—and blessed shalt thou be when thou goest out:

content: 7 Yahweh will deliver thine enemies who rise up against thee, to be routed before thee,—one way shall they come out against thee, and seven ways shall they flee before thee:
content_old: 7 Yahweh will deliver thine enemies who rise up against thee, to be routed before thee,—one way shall they come out against thee, and seven ways shall they flee before thee:

content: 8 Yahweh will command to be with thee､ the blessing, in thy storehouses､ and in all whereunto thou settest thy hand,—and will bless thee in the land which Yahweh thy God is giving unto thee:
content_old: 8 Yahweh will command to be with thee､ the blessing, in thy storehouses､ and in all whereunto thou settest thy hand,—and will bless thee in the land which Yahweh thy God is giving unto thee:

content: 9 Yahweh will confirm thee unto himself for a holy people, as he sware unto thee,—because thou dost keep the commandments of Yahweh thy God, and dost walk in his ways.
content_old: 9 Yahweh will confirm thee unto himself for a holy people, as he sware unto thee,—because thou dost keep the commandments of Yahweh thy God, and dost walk in his ways.

content: 10 And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of Yahweh hath been called upon thee,—and shall be afraid of thee.
content_old: 10 And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of Yahweh hath been called upon thee,—and shall be afraid of thee.

content: 11 And Yahweh will cause thee to abound in that which is good, in the fruit of thy body､ and in the fruit of thy cattle､ and in the fruit of thy soil,—upon the soil which Yahweh sware unto thy fathers､ to give unto thee:
content_old: 11 And Yahweh will cause thee to abound in that which is good, in the fruit of thy body､ and in the fruit of thy cattle､ and in the fruit of thy soil,—upon the soil which Yahweh sware unto thy fathers､ to give unto thee:

content: 12 Yahweh will open unto thee his rich storehouse—the heavens､ to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless every work of thy hand, so shalt thou lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow:
content_old: 12 Yahweh will open unto thee his rich storehouse—the heavens､ to give the rain of thy land in its season, and to bless every work of thy hand, so shalt thou lend unto many nations, but thou shalt not borrow:

content: 13 And Yahweh will give thee to be the head､ and not the tail, and thou shalt be only above, and shalt not be beneath,—because thou dost hearken unto the commandments of Yahweh thy God､ which I am commanding thee､ to-day､ to observe and to do;
content_old: 13 And Yahweh will give thee to be the head､ and not the tail, and thou shalt be only above, and shalt not be beneath,—because thou dost hearken unto the commandments of Yahweh thy God､ which I am commanding thee､ to-day､ to observe and to do;

content: 14 and dost not turn aside from any of the words which I am commanding you to-day､ to the right hand or to the left,—to go after other gods､ to serve them.
content_old: 14 and dost not turn aside from any of the words which I am commanding you to-day､ to the right hand or to the left,—to go after other gods､ to serve them.

content: 15 But it shall be､ if thou do not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes､ which I am commanding thee､ to-day then shall come in upon thee all these curses､ and shall reach thee:—
content_old: 15 But it shall be､ if thou do not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to observe to do all his commandments and his statutes､ which I am commanding thee､ to-day then shall come in upon thee all these curses､ and shall reach thee:—

content: 16 Cursed shalt thou be in the city,—and cursed shalt thou be in the field:
content_old: 16 Cursed shalt thou be in the city,—and cursed shalt thou be in the field:

content: 17 Cursed shall be thy basket､ and thy kneading-trough:
content_old: 17 Cursed shall be thy basket､ and thy kneading-trough:

content: 18 Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body､ and the fruit of thy ground､—the young of thy kine､ and the ewes of thy flock:
content_old: 18 Cursed shall be the fruit of thy body､ and the fruit of thy ground､—the young of thy kine､ and the ewes of thy flock:

content: 19 Cursed shalt thou be､ when thou comest in,—and cursed shalt thou be､ when thou goest out:
content_old: 19 Cursed shalt thou be､ when thou comest in,—and cursed shalt thou be､ when thou goest out:

content: 20 Yahweh will send upon thee cursing､ confusion､ and rebuke, in all whereunto thou settest thy hand､ that thou mayest do it,—until thou be destroyed､ and until thou perish quickly, because of the wickedness of thy doings､ whereby thou hast forsaken me.
content_old: 20 Yahweh will send upon thee cursing､ confusion､ and rebuke, in all whereunto thou settest thy hand､ that thou mayest do it,—until thou be destroyed､ and until thou perish quickly, because of the wickedness of thy doings､ whereby thou hast forsaken me.

content: 21 Yahweh will cause to cleave unto thee—the pestilence,—until he hath consumed thee､ from off the soil､ which thou art entering to possess.
content_old: 21 Yahweh will cause to cleave unto thee—the pestilence,—until he hath consumed thee､ from off the soil､ which thou art entering to possess.

content: 22 Yahweh will smite thee with consumption and with fever､ and with inflammation and with violent heat､ and with the sword, and with blight､ and with mildew,—and they shall pursue thee､ until thou perish.
content_old: 22 Yahweh will smite thee with consumption and with fever､ and with inflammation and with violent heat､ and with the sword, and with blight､ and with mildew,—and they shall pursue thee､ until thou perish.

content: 23 And thy heavens which are over thy head､ shall become bronze,—and the earth which is under thee iron.
content_old: 23 And thy heavens which are over thy head､ shall become bronze,—and the earth which is under thee iron.

content: 24 Yahweh will cause the rain of thy land to be powder and dust,—out of the heavens shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.
content_old: 24 Yahweh will cause the rain of thy land to be powder and dust,—out of the heavens shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.

content: 25 Yahweh will give thee up to be routed before thine enemies, one way shalt thou go out against them, and seven ways shalt thou flee before them,—and thou shalt become a terror unto all the kingdoms of the earth.
content_old: 25 Yahweh will give thee up to be routed before thine enemies, one way shalt thou go out against them, and seven ways shalt thou flee before them,—and thou shalt become a terror unto all the kingdoms of the earth.

content: 26 And thy dead body shall become food for every bird of the heavens､ and for the beast of the earth,—with none to fright them away.
content_old: 26 And thy dead body shall become food for every bird of the heavens､ and for the beast of the earth,—with none to fright them away.

content: 27 Yahweh will smite thee with the burning sores of Egypt､ and with the hæmorrhoids, and with scab､ and with itch,—of which thou canst not be healed.
content_old: 27 Yahweh will smite thee with the burning sores of Egypt､ and with the hæmorrhoids, and with scab､ and with itch,—of which thou canst not be healed.

content: 28 Yahweh will smite thee with madness､ and with blindness,—and with terror of heart;
content_old: 28 Yahweh will smite thee with madness､ and with blindness,—and with terror of heart;

content: 29 and thou shalt be groping about in noonday brightness､ as the blind man gropeth in thick darkness, and thou shalt not make thy ways prosper,—but shalt be only oppressed and spoiled､ all the days､ with none to save.
content_old: 29 and thou shalt be groping about in noonday brightness､ as the blind man gropeth in thick darkness, and thou shalt not make thy ways prosper,—but shalt be only oppressed and spoiled､ all the days､ with none to save.

content: 30 A wife shalt thou betroth､ and another man shall lie with her, A house shalt thou build､ and shalt not dwell therein,— A vineyard shalt thou plant, and shalt not throw it open;
content_old: 30 A wife shalt thou betroth､ and another man shall lie with her, A house shalt thou build､ and shalt not dwell therein,— A vineyard shalt thou plant, and shalt not throw it open;

content: 31 Thine ox slaughtered before thine eyes and thou shalt not eat thereof, Thine ass stolen from before thee and shall not be restored to thee,— Thy flock given to thine enemies and thou shalt have none to save.
content_old: 31 Thine ox slaughtered before thine eyes and thou shalt not eat thereof, Thine ass stolen from before thee and shall not be restored to thee,— Thy flock given to thine enemies and thou shalt have none to save.

content: 32 Thy sons and thy daughters given to another people thine eyes looking on､ and failing for them all the day,—thine own hand being powerless.
content_old: 32 Thy sons and thy daughters given to another people thine eyes looking on､ and failing for them all the day,—thine own hand being powerless.

content: 33 The fruit of thy soil､ and all thy toilsome-produce shall a people whom thou knowest not､ eat up,—and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed､ all the days;
content_old: 33 The fruit of thy soil､ and all thy toilsome-produce shall a people whom thou knowest not､ eat up,—and thou shalt be only oppressed and crushed､ all the days;

content: 34 so that thou shalt be mad,—for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.
content_old: 34 so that thou shalt be mad,—for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.

content: 35 Yahweh will smite thee with a grievous boil､ upon the knees and upon the legs, of which thou canst not be healed,—from the sole of thy foot､ even unto the crown of thy head.
content_old: 35 Yahweh will smite thee with a grievous boil､ upon the knees and upon the legs, of which thou canst not be healed,—from the sole of thy foot､ even unto the crown of thy head.

content: 36 Yahweh will bring thee､ and thy king whom thou wilt set up over thee, unto a nation which thou hast not known､ thou､ nor thy fathers,—and thou shalt serve､ there､ other gods､ of wood and of stone.
content_old: 36 Yahweh will bring thee､ and thy king whom thou wilt set up over thee, unto a nation which thou hast not known､ thou､ nor thy fathers,—and thou shalt serve､ there､ other gods､ of wood and of stone.

content: 37 Thus shalt thou become a horror, a byword､ and a mockery,—among all the peoples whither Yahweh thy God will drive thee.
content_old: 37 Thus shalt thou become a horror, a byword､ and a mockery,—among all the peoples whither Yahweh thy God will drive thee.

content: 38 Much seed shalt thou take out into the field,—and little shalt thou gather in, for the locust shall consume it.
content_old: 38 Much seed shalt thou take out into the field,—and little shalt thou gather in, for the locust shall consume it.

content: 39 Vineyards shalt thou plant､ and dress,—but wine shalt thou not drink, neither shalt thou gather the grapes､ for the worm shall eat them.
content_old: 39 Vineyards shalt thou plant､ and dress,—but wine shalt thou not drink, neither shalt thou gather the grapes､ for the worm shall eat them.

content: 40 Olive trees shalt thou have in all thy bounds,—but with oil shalt thou not anoint thyself, for thine olives shall drop off.
content_old: 40 Olive trees shalt thou have in all thy bounds,—but with oil shalt thou not anoint thyself, for thine olives shall drop off.

content: 41 Sons and daughters shalt thou beget,—and they shall not be thine, for they shall go into captivity.
content_old: 41 Sons and daughters shalt thou beget,—and they shall not be thine, for they shall go into captivity.

content: 42 All thy trees､ and the fruit of thy ground shall the grasshopper devour.
content_old: 42 All thy trees､ and the fruit of thy ground shall the grasshopper devour.

content: 43 The sojourner who is in thy midst shall mount up above thee､ higher and higher,—whereas thou shalt come down､ lower and lower:
content_old: 43 The sojourner who is in thy midst shall mount up above thee､ higher and higher,—whereas thou shalt come down､ lower and lower:

content: 44 he shall lend to thee, but thou shalt not lend to him,—he shall become head, and thou shalt become tail.
content_old: 44 he shall lend to thee, but thou shalt not lend to him,—he shall become head, and thou shalt become tail.

content: 45 Moreover, all these curses shall come in upon thee and pursue thee and overtake thee, until thou be destroyed,—because thou didst not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes､ which he hath commanded thee;
content_old: 45 Moreover, all these curses shall come in upon thee and pursue thee and overtake thee, until thou be destroyed,—because thou didst not hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to keep his commandments and his statutes､ which he hath commanded thee;

content: 46 and they shall be upon thee, for a sign､ and for a wonder,—and upon thy seed､ unto times age-abiding.
content_old: 46 and they shall be upon thee, for a sign､ and for a wonder,—and upon thy seed､ unto times age-abiding.

content: 47 Because thou servedst not Yahweh thy God, with rejoicing､ and with gladness of heart, for abundance of all things
content_old: 47 Because thou servedst not Yahweh thy God, with rejoicing､ and with gladness of heart, for abundance of all things

content: 48 therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies､ whom Yahweh will send against thee, with hunger､ and with thirst､ and with nakedness､ and with want of all things,—and he will put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he hath destroyed thee.
content_old: 48 therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies､ whom Yahweh will send against thee, with hunger､ and with thirst､ and with nakedness､ and with want of all things,—and he will put a yoke of iron upon thy neck, until he hath destroyed thee.

content: 49 Yahweh will bring against thee a nation from afar､ from the end of the earth, as darteth a bird of prey,—a nation whose tongue thou canst not understand;
content_old: 49 Yahweh will bring against thee a nation from afar､ from the end of the earth, as darteth a bird of prey,—a nation whose tongue thou canst not understand;

content: 50 a nation of fierce countenance,—who will not respect an elder､ nor to the young show favour;
content_old: 50 a nation of fierce countenance,—who will not respect an elder､ nor to the young show favour;

content: 51 then shall he eat the young of thy cattle and the fruit of thy ground､ until thou art destroyed, who will not leave for thee corn, new wine or oil, the young of thy kine, or the ewes of thy flock､—until he hath caused thee to perish.
content_old: 51 then shall he eat the young of thy cattle and the fruit of thy ground､ until thou art destroyed, who will not leave for thee corn, new wine or oil, the young of thy kine, or the ewes of thy flock､—until he hath caused thee to perish.

content: 52 And he shall lay siege to thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down､ wherein thou wast trusting､ in all thy land,—yea he will lay siege to thee in all thy gates, in all thy land､ which Yahweh thy God hath given unto thee.
content_old: 52 And he shall lay siege to thee in all thy gates, until thy high and fortified walls come down､ wherein thou wast trusting､ in all thy land,—yea he will lay siege to thee in all thy gates, in all thy land､ which Yahweh thy God hath given unto thee.

content: 53 And thou wilt eat the fruit of thy body､ the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, whom Yahweh thy God hath given unto thee—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten thee.
content_old: 53 And thou wilt eat the fruit of thy body､ the flesh of thy sons and of thy daughters, whom Yahweh thy God hath given unto thee—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten thee.

content: 54 The man that is tender among you, and exceedingly delicate his eye will be jealous of his brother､ and of the wife of his bosom, and of the remnant of his sons､ whom he might leave behind;
content_old: 54 The man that is tender among you, and exceedingly delicate his eye will be jealous of his brother､ and of the wife of his bosom, and of the remnant of his sons､ whom he might leave behind;

content: 55 so that he will not give to any one of them､ of the flesh of his sons which he will eat, because he hath nothing at all left him,—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten theewithin all thy gates.
content_old: 55 so that he will not give to any one of them､ of the flesh of his sons which he will eat, because he hath nothing at all left him,—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten theewithin all thy gates.

content: 56 The tender and delicate woman among you､ who hath never adventured the sole of her foot､ to set it upon the ground, through delicateness and through tenderness her eye shall be jealous of the husband of her bosom, and of her own son, and of her own daughter;
content_old: 56 The tender and delicate woman among you､ who hath never adventured the sole of her foot､ to set it upon the ground, through delicateness and through tenderness her eye shall be jealous of the husband of her bosom, and of her own son, and of her own daughter;

content: 57 both as to her afterbirth that cometh forth from between her feet and as to her children which she shall bear, for she will eat them for want of all things secretly,—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten thee within thine own gates.
content_old: 57 both as to her afterbirth that cometh forth from between her feet and as to her children which she shall bear, for she will eat them for want of all things secretly,—in the siege and in the straitness wherewith thine enemy will straiten thee within thine own gates.

content: 58 If thou wilt not take heed to do all the words of this law, which are written in this scroll,—to revere this glorious and reverend name, Yahweh thy God
content_old: 58 If thou wilt not take heed to do all the words of this law, which are written in this scroll,—to revere this glorious and reverend name, Yahweh thy God

content: 59 then will Yahweh make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed,—plagues great and lasting､ and diseases grievous and lasting;
content_old: 59 then will Yahweh make thy plagues wonderful, and the plagues of thy seed,—plagues great and lasting､ and diseases grievous and lasting;

content: 60 and he will bring back on thee all the sickness of Egypt, because of which thou wast afraid,—and they shall cleave unto thee;
content_old: 60 and he will bring back on thee all the sickness of Egypt, because of which thou wast afraid,—and they shall cleave unto thee;

content: 61 even every disease and every plague, which are not written in this scroll of the law will Yahweh bring up against thee, until thou art destroyed.
content_old: 61 even every disease and every plague, which are not written in this scroll of the law will Yahweh bring up against thee, until thou art destroyed.

content: 62 And ye shall be left men few in number, whereas ye had become as the stars of the heavens､ for multitude,—because thou hast not hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh thy God.
content_old: 62 And ye shall be left men few in number, whereas ye had become as the stars of the heavens､ for multitude,—because thou hast not hearkened unto the voice of Yahweh thy God.

content: 63 And it shall come to pass that as Yahweh rejoiced over you to do you good and to multiply you so will Yahweh rejoice over you, to cause you to perish and to destroy you,—and ye shall be torn away､ from off the soil, whither thou art going in to possess it;
content_old: 63 And it shall come to pass that as Yahweh rejoiced over you to do you good and to multiply you so will Yahweh rejoice over you, to cause you to perish and to destroy you,—and ye shall be torn away､ from off the soil, whither thou art going in to possess it;

content: 64 and Yahweh will scatter thee among all the peoples, from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth,—and thou wilt serve there other gods whom thou hast not known—thou nor thy fathers—of wood and of stone.
content_old: 64 and Yahweh will scatter thee among all the peoples, from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth,—and thou wilt serve there other gods whom thou hast not known—thou nor thy fathers—of wood and of stone.

content: 65 And among those nations shalt thou find no ease, neither shall there be a place of rest for the sole of thy foot,—but Yahweh will give unto thee there a trembling heart, and a failing of eyes and faintness of soul.
content_old: 65 And among those nations shalt thou find no ease, neither shall there be a place of rest for the sole of thy foot,—but Yahweh will give unto thee there a trembling heart, and a failing of eyes and faintness of soul.

content: 66 And thy life will be hung up for thee in front,—and thou wilt be in dread by night and by day, and wilt not trust in thy life.
content_old: 66 And thy life will be hung up for thee in front,—and thou wilt be in dread by night and by day, and wilt not trust in thy life.

content: 67 In the morning thou wilt say— Oh that it were evening! and in the evening thou wilt say— Oh that it were morning! because of the dread of thy heart which thou wilt dread, and because of the sight of thine eyes､ which thou wilt see.
content_old: 67 In the morning thou wilt say— Oh that it were evening! and in the evening thou wilt say— Oh that it were morning! because of the dread of thy heart which thou wilt dread, and because of the sight of thine eyes､ which thou wilt see.

content: 1 These are the words of the covenant which Yahweh commanded Moses to solemnise with the sons of Israel､ in the land of Moab,—besides the covenant, which he solemnised with them in Horeb.
content_old: 1 These are the words of the covenant which Yahweh commanded Moses to solemnise with the sons of Israel､ in the land of Moab,—besides the covenant, which he solemnised with them in Horeb.

content: 2 And Moses called unto all Israel and said unto them,— Ye yourselves saw all that Yahweh did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, unto Pharaoh and unto all his servants and unto all his land:
content_old: 2 And Moses called unto all Israel and said unto them,— Ye yourselves saw all that Yahweh did before your eyes in the land of Egypt, unto Pharaoh and unto all his servants and unto all his land:

content: 3 the great provings which thine own eyes saw,—those great signs and wonders:
content_old: 3 the great provings which thine own eyes saw,—those great signs and wonders:

content: 4 yet hath Yahweh not given unto you a heart to know, or eyes to see or ears to hear,—until this day.
content_old: 4 yet hath Yahweh not given unto you a heart to know, or eyes to see or ears to hear,—until this day.

content: 5 I led you､ therefore forty years in the desert,—your mantles fell not with age from off you, even thy sandal fell not with age from off thy foot:
content_old: 5 I led you､ therefore forty years in the desert,—your mantles fell not with age from off you, even thy sandal fell not with age from off thy foot:

content: 6 Bread ye did not eat, and wine and strong drink ye did not drink,—that ye might know that I, Yahweh was your God.
content_old: 6 Bread ye did not eat, and wine and strong drink ye did not drink,—that ye might know that I, Yahweh was your God.

content: 7 And when ye entered into this place then came forth Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan､ to meet us in battle､ and we smote them;
content_old: 7 And when ye entered into this place then came forth Sihon king of Heshbon and Og king of Bashan､ to meet us in battle､ and we smote them;

content: 8 and we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites､ and unto the Gadites,—and unto the half tribe of Manasseh.
content_old: 8 and we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites､ and unto the Gadites,—and unto the half tribe of Manasseh.

content: 9 Ye must､ therefore､ keep the words of this covenant, and do them,—that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
content_old: 9 Ye must､ therefore､ keep the words of this covenant, and do them,—that ye may prosper in all that ye do.

content: 10 Ye are stationed､ to-day､ all of you, before Yahweh your God,—your heads､ your tribes､ and your elders､ and your officers, every man of Israel;
content_old: 10 Ye are stationed､ to-day､ all of you, before Yahweh your God,—your heads､ your tribes､ and your elders､ and your officers, every man of Israel;

content: 11 your little ones､ your wives, and thy sojourner that is in the midst of thy camps,—from him that heweth thy wood､ unto him that draweth thy water:
content_old: 11 your little ones､ your wives, and thy sojourner that is in the midst of thy camps,—from him that heweth thy wood､ unto him that draweth thy water:

content: 12 that thou mayest pass through into the covenant of Yahweh thy God､ and into his oath,—which Yahweh thy God is solemnising with thee､ to-day:
content_old: 12 that thou mayest pass through into the covenant of Yahweh thy God､ and into his oath,—which Yahweh thy God is solemnising with thee､ to-day:

content: 13 that he may confirm thee to-day as his own people, while he becometh thine own God, as he spake unto thee,—and as he sware unto thy fathers, unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob.
content_old: 13 that he may confirm thee to-day as his own people, while he becometh thine own God, as he spake unto thee,—and as he sware unto thy fathers, unto Abraham､ unto Isaac､ and unto Jacob.

content: 14 And not with you alone am I solemnising this covenant and this oath;
content_old: 14 And not with you alone am I solemnising this covenant and this oath;

content: 15 but with him who is here､ with us､ standing to-day before Yahweh our God,—and with him who is not here､ with us to-day.
content_old: 15 but with him who is here､ with us､ standing to-day before Yahweh our God,—and with him who is not here､ with us to-day.

content: 16 (For ye know, how we dwelt in the land of Egypt,—and how we passed through the midst of the nations which ye did pass through;
content_old: 16 (For ye know, how we dwelt in the land of Egypt,—and how we passed through the midst of the nations which ye did pass through;

content: 17 and ye saw their disgusting images, and their manufactured gods,—the wood and the stone, the silver and the gold that are with them.)
content_old: 17 and ye saw their disgusting images, and their manufactured gods,—the wood and the stone, the silver and the gold that are with them.)

content: 18 Lest there be among you—a man or a woman､ or a family or a tribe､ whose heart is turning to-day､ from Yahweh our God, to go and serve the gods of those nations,—lest there be among you､ a root fruitful of poison and wormwood;
content_old: 18 Lest there be among you—a man or a woman､ or a family or a tribe､ whose heart is turning to-day､ from Yahweh our God, to go and serve the gods of those nations,—lest there be among you､ a root fruitful of poison and wormwood;

content: 19 and so it come to pass while he is hearing the words of this oath that he will bless himself in his heart—saying､ Prosperity shall I have, although in the stubbornness of my heart I go on,— so that the drunkenness addeth to the thirst:
content_old: 19 and so it come to pass while he is hearing the words of this oath that he will bless himself in his heart—saying､ Prosperity shall I have, although in the stubbornness of my heart I go on,— so that the drunkenness addeth to the thirst:

content: 20 Yahweh will not be willing to forgive him, but then will the anger of Yahweh and his jealousy smoke against that man, and all the oath that is written in this scroll shall settle down upon him,—and Yahweh wipe out his name from under the heavens;
content_old: 20 Yahweh will not be willing to forgive him, but then will the anger of Yahweh and his jealousy smoke against that man, and all the oath that is written in this scroll shall settle down upon him,—and Yahweh wipe out his name from under the heavens;

content: 21 and Yahweh single him out for calamity, out of all the tribes of Israel,—according to all the oaths of the covenant that is written in this scroll of the law.
content_old: 21 and Yahweh single him out for calamity, out of all the tribes of Israel,—according to all the oaths of the covenant that is written in this scroll of the law.

content: 22 So that the generation coming after—your sons who shall rise up after you, and the foreigner who shall come in from a far-off land, will say—when they see the plagues of that land､ and the sicknesses thereof wherewith Yahweh hath made it sick:
content_old: 22 So that the generation coming after—your sons who shall rise up after you, and the foreigner who shall come in from a far-off land, will say—when they see the plagues of that land､ and the sicknesses thereof wherewith Yahweh hath made it sick:

content: 23 brimstone and salt､ burning up all the land thereof, it shall not be sown､ neither shall it shoot forth, neither shall there come up thereon any herbage,—like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah､ Admah and Zeboiim, which Yahweh overthrew in his anger and in his wrath:
content_old: 23 brimstone and salt､ burning up all the land thereof, it shall not be sown､ neither shall it shoot forth, neither shall there come up thereon any herbage,—like the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah､ Admah and Zeboiim, which Yahweh overthrew in his anger and in his wrath:

content: 24 yea all the nations will say, For what cause hath Yahweh done thus unto this land? what meaneth this great heat of anger?
content_old: 24 yea all the nations will say, For what cause hath Yahweh done thus unto this land? what meaneth this great heat of anger?

content: 25 Then will men say, Because they forsook the covenant of Yahweh､ the God of their fathers,—which he solemnised with them, when he brought them forth､ out of the land of Egypt;
content_old: 25 Then will men say, Because they forsook the covenant of Yahweh､ the God of their fathers,—which he solemnised with them, when he brought them forth､ out of the land of Egypt;

content: 26 and went and served other gods, and bowed down to them,—gods which they had not known, and in which he had given them no share:
content_old: 26 and went and served other gods, and bowed down to them,—gods which they had not known, and in which he had given them no share:

content: 27 therefore did the anger of Yahweh kindle upon that land,—to bring in upon it all the curse that is written in this scroll;
content_old: 27 therefore did the anger of Yahweh kindle upon that land,—to bring in upon it all the curse that is written in this scroll;

content: 28 and therefore hath Yahweh rooted them out from off their own soil, in anger and in wrath､ and in great indignation,—and cast them into another land､ as at this day.
content_old: 28 and therefore hath Yahweh rooted them out from off their own soil, in anger and in wrath､ and in great indignation,—and cast them into another land､ as at this day.

content: 1 And it shall come to pass､ when all these things shall come in upon thee—the blessing and the curse､ which I have set before thee,—and thou shalt bring them back unto thy heart, among all the nations whither Yahweh thy God hath driven thee;
content_old: 1 And it shall come to pass､ when all these things shall come in upon thee—the blessing and the curse､ which I have set before thee,—and thou shalt bring them back unto thy heart, among all the nations whither Yahweh thy God hath driven thee;

content: 2 and thou shalt return unto Yahweh thy God､ and shalt hearken unto his voice, according to all that I am commanding thee to-day,—thou and thy sons with all thy heart, and with all thy soul
content_old: 2 and thou shalt return unto Yahweh thy God､ and shalt hearken unto his voice, according to all that I am commanding thee to-day,—thou and thy sons with all thy heart, and with all thy soul

content: 3 then will Yahweh thy God bring back thy captivity､ and have compassion upon thee,—and return and gather thee､ from among all the peoples whither Yahweh thy God hath scattered thee.
content_old: 3 then will Yahweh thy God bring back thy captivity､ and have compassion upon thee,—and return and gather thee､ from among all the peoples whither Yahweh thy God hath scattered thee.

content: 4 Though thou be driven out unto the utmost part of the heavens from thence will Yahweh thy God gather thee, and from thence will he fetch thee;
content_old: 4 Though thou be driven out unto the utmost part of the heavens from thence will Yahweh thy God gather thee, and from thence will he fetch thee;

content: 5 and Yahweh thy God will bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed､ and thou shalt possess it,—and he will do thee I good and multiply thee､ beyond thy fathers.
content_old: 5 and Yahweh thy God will bring thee into the land which thy fathers possessed､ and thou shalt possess it,—and he will do thee I good and multiply thee､ beyond thy fathers.

content: 6 And Yahweh thy God will circumcise thy heart､ and the heart of thy seed,—to love Yahweh thy God with all thy heart and I with all thy soul､ that thou mayest live.
content_old: 6 And Yahweh thy God will circumcise thy heart､ and the heart of thy seed,—to love Yahweh thy God with all thy heart and I with all thy soul､ that thou mayest live.

content: 7 And Yahweh thy God will put all these oaths upon thine enemies and upon them who hated thee､ who persecuted thee.
content_old: 7 And Yahweh thy God will put all these oaths upon thine enemies and upon them who hated thee､ who persecuted thee.

content: 8 But thou wilt return, and hearken unto the voice of Yahweh,—and wilt do all his commandments, which I am commanding thee､ to-day.
content_old: 8 But thou wilt return, and hearken unto the voice of Yahweh,—and wilt do all his commandments, which I am commanding thee､ to-day.

content: 9 And Yahweh thy God will make thee pre-eminent､ in every work of thy hand—in the fruit of thy body､ and in the fruit of thy cattle､ and in the fruit of thy ground､ for good,—for Yahweh will again rejoice over thee for good, as he rejoiced over thy fathers:
content_old: 9 And Yahweh thy God will make thee pre-eminent､ in every work of thy hand—in the fruit of thy body､ and in the fruit of thy cattle､ and in the fruit of thy ground､ for good,—for Yahweh will again rejoice over thee for good, as he rejoiced over thy fathers:

content: 10 if thou hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to keep his commandments､ and his statutes, which are written in this scroll of the law,—if thou return unto Yahweh thy God, with all thy heart and with all thy soul.
content_old: 10 if thou hearken unto the voice of Yahweh thy God, to keep his commandments､ and his statutes, which are written in this scroll of the law,—if thou return unto Yahweh thy God, with all thy heart and with all thy soul.

content: 11 For as touching this commandment, which I am commanding thee to-day it is not too wonderful for thee, neither is it far off.
content_old: 11 For as touching this commandment, which I am commanding thee to-day it is not too wonderful for thee, neither is it far off.

content: 12 It is not in the heavens,—that thou shouldest say— Who shall ascend for us into the heavens､ that he may fetch it for us, that we may hear it, and do it?
content_old: 12 It is not in the heavens,—that thou shouldest say— Who shall ascend for us into the heavens､ that he may fetch it for us, that we may hear it, and do it?

content: 13 Neither is it over the sea—that thou shouldest say､ Who will pass over for us､ to the other side of the sea､ that he may fetch it for us, that we may hear it, and do it?
content_old: 13 Neither is it over the sea—that thou shouldest say､ Who will pass over for us､ to the other side of the sea､ that he may fetch it for us, that we may hear it, and do it?

content: 14 But near unto thee is the word､ exceedingly,—in thy mouth and in thy heart､ that thou mayest do it.
content_old: 14 But near unto thee is the word､ exceedingly,—in thy mouth and in thy heart､ that thou mayest do it.

content: 15 See! I have set before thee､ to-day, life and prosperity,—and death and calamity;
content_old: 15 See! I have set before thee､ to-day, life and prosperity,—and death and calamity;

content: 16 for thou must keep the commandments of Yahweh thy God which I am commanding thee､ to-day, to love Yahweh thy God､ to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes､ and his regulations,—so shalt thou live and multiply, and Yahweh thy God will bless thee､ in the land which thou art entering to possess.
content_old: 16 for thou must keep the commandments of Yahweh thy God which I am commanding thee､ to-day, to love Yahweh thy God､ to walk in his ways, and to keep his commandments and his statutes､ and his regulations,—so shalt thou live and multiply, and Yahweh thy God will bless thee､ in the land which thou art entering to possess.

content: 17 But if thy heart shall turn away､ and thou wilt not hearken,—but shalt be drawn away､ and shalt bow thyself down to other gods､ and serve them
content_old: 17 But if thy heart shall turn away､ and thou wilt not hearken,—but shalt be drawn away､ and shalt bow thyself down to other gods､ and serve them

content: 18 I declare unto you､ to-day, that ye shall perish,—ye shall not prolong your days､ upon the soil which thou art passing over the Jordan to enter and possess.
content_old: 18 I declare unto you､ to-day, that ye shall perish,—ye shall not prolong your days､ upon the soil which thou art passing over the Jordan to enter and possess.

content: 19 I call to witness against you to-day､ the heavens and the earth, that life and death have I set before thee, the blessing and the curse,—therefore shouldest thou choose life, that thou mayest live､ thou and thy seed;
content_old: 19 I call to witness against you to-day､ the heavens and the earth, that life and death have I set before thee, the blessing and the curse,—therefore shouldest thou choose life, that thou mayest live､ thou and thy seed;

content: 1 And Moses went, and spake these words､ unto all Israel;
content_old: 1 And Moses went, and spake these words､ unto all Israel;

content: 2 and said unto them— A hundred and twenty years old am I to-day, I can no more go out and come in,—Yahweh indeed hath said unto me, Thou shalt not pass over this Jordan.
content_old: 2 and said unto them— A hundred and twenty years old am I to-day, I can no more go out and come in,—Yahweh indeed hath said unto me, Thou shalt not pass over this Jordan.

content: 3 Yahweh thy God is passing over before thee､ he will destroy these nations from before thee､ so shalt thou dispossess them,—Joshua is passing over before thee, as Yahweh hath spoken.
content_old: 3 Yahweh thy God is passing over before thee､ he will destroy these nations from before thee､ so shalt thou dispossess them,—Joshua is passing over before thee, as Yahweh hath spoken.

content: 4 So will Yahweh do unto them as he did unto Sihon and unto Og､ kings of the Amorites､ and unto the land of them whom he destroyed.
content_old: 4 So will Yahweh do unto them as he did unto Sihon and unto Og､ kings of the Amorites､ and unto the land of them whom he destroyed.

content: 5 So will Yahweh deliver them up before you,—and ye shall do unto them—according to all the commandment which I have commanded you.
content_old: 5 So will Yahweh deliver them up before you,—and ye shall do unto them—according to all the commandment which I have commanded you.

content: 6 Be firm and bold, do not fear nor tremble､ because of them,—for Yahweh thy God it is who is going with thee, he will not fail thee nor forsake thee.
content_old: 6 Be firm and bold, do not fear nor tremble､ because of them,—for Yahweh thy God it is who is going with thee, he will not fail thee nor forsake thee.

content: 7 And Moses called for Joshua､ and said unto him､ in the sight of all Israel､ Be firm and bold, for thou shalt go with this people､ into the land which Yahweh sware unto their fathers､ to give unto them, and thou shalt cause them to inherit it.
content_old: 7 And Moses called for Joshua､ and said unto him､ in the sight of all Israel､ Be firm and bold, for thou shalt go with this people､ into the land which Yahweh sware unto their fathers､ to give unto them, and thou shalt cause them to inherit it.

content: 8 But Yahweh it is who is going before thee､ be will be with thee, he will not fail thee､ nor forsake thee,—thou must not fear､ nor be dismayed.
content_old: 8 But Yahweh it is who is going before thee､ be will be with thee, he will not fail thee､ nor forsake thee,—thou must not fear､ nor be dismayed.

content: 9 And Moses wrote this law, and delivered it unto the priests､ the sons of Levi, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh,—and unto all the elders of Israel.
content_old: 9 And Moses wrote this law, and delivered it unto the priests､ the sons of Levi, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh,—and unto all the elders of Israel.

content: 10 And Moses commanded them､ saying,— At the end of seven years､ in the appointed season of the year of release､ during the festival of booths;
content_old: 10 And Moses commanded them､ saying,— At the end of seven years､ in the appointed season of the year of release､ during the festival of booths;

content: 11 when all Israel cometh in to see the face of Yahweh thy God, in the place which he shall choose thou shalt read this law before all Israel､ in their hearing.
content_old: 11 when all Israel cometh in to see the face of Yahweh thy God, in the place which he shall choose thou shalt read this law before all Israel､ in their hearing.

content: 12 Call together the people—the men､ and the women､ and the little ones, and thy sojourner､ who is within thy gates,—that they may hear､ and that they may learn､ so shall they revere Yahweh your God, and observe to do all the words of this law;
content_old: 12 Call together the people—the men､ and the women､ and the little ones, and thy sojourner､ who is within thy gates,—that they may hear､ and that they may learn､ so shall they revere Yahweh your God, and observe to do all the words of this law;

content: 13 and that their children who know not may hear and learn, that they may revere Yahweh your God,—all the days that ye are living upon the soil, which ye are passing over the Jordan､ to possess.
content_old: 13 and that their children who know not may hear and learn, that they may revere Yahweh your God,—all the days that ye are living upon the soil, which ye are passing over the Jordan､ to possess.

content: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Lo! thy days have drawn near､ that thou must die. Call Joshua､ and station yourselves in the tent of meeting､ that I may command him. So Moses went､ with Joshua, and they took their station in the tent of meeting.
content_old: 14 Then said Yahweh unto Moses: Lo! thy days have drawn near､ that thou must die. Call Joshua､ and station yourselves in the tent of meeting､ that I may command him. So Moses went､ with Joshua, and they took their station in the tent of meeting.

content: 15 And Yahweh appeared in the tent､ in a pillar of cloud,—and the pillar of cloud stood､ at the entrance of the tent.
content_old: 15 And Yahweh appeared in the tent､ in a pillar of cloud,—and the pillar of cloud stood､ at the entrance of the tent.

content: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Lo! thou art about to sleep with thy fathers,—and this people will rise up, and go away unchastely after the gods of the foreigners of the land､ into the midst of whom they are entering, and will forsake me､ and break my covenant which I solemnised with them.
content_old: 16 Then said Yahweh unto Moses, Lo! thou art about to sleep with thy fathers,—and this people will rise up, and go away unchastely after the gods of the foreigners of the land､ into the midst of whom they are entering, and will forsake me､ and break my covenant which I solemnised with them.

content: 17 Then will mine anger kindle upon them in that day､ and I will forsake them､ and will hide my face from them､ and they shall be consumed, and many calamities and misfortunes shall find them out,—and they will say, in that day, Is it not because my God is not in my midst, that these calamities have found me out?
content_old: 17 Then will mine anger kindle upon them in that day､ and I will forsake them､ and will hide my face from them､ and they shall be consumed, and many calamities and misfortunes shall find them out,—and they will say, in that day, Is it not because my God is not in my midst, that these calamities have found me out?

content: 18 But I will utterly hide my face､ in that day, because of all the wickedness which they have done, in that they have turned away unto other gods.
content_old: 18 But I will utterly hide my face､ in that day, because of all the wickedness which they have done, in that they have turned away unto other gods.

content: 19 Now therefore､ write ye for you this Song, and teach it unto the sons of Israel､ put it in their mouths,—that this Song may become for me､ a witness､ against the sons of Israel.
content_old: 19 Now therefore､ write ye for you this Song, and teach it unto the sons of Israel､ put it in their mouths,—that this Song may become for me､ a witness､ against the sons of Israel.

content: 20 When I bring them upon the soil which I sware unto their fathers､ flowing with milk and honey, and they shall eat and be filled､ and wax fat then will they turn away unto other gods and serve them, and despise me､ and break my covenant.
content_old: 20 When I bring them upon the soil which I sware unto their fathers､ flowing with milk and honey, and they shall eat and be filled､ and wax fat then will they turn away unto other gods and serve them, and despise me､ and break my covenant.

content: 21 And it shall come to pass when many calamities and misfortunes shall find them out then shall this Song respond to their face､ as a witness, for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouth of their seed, for I know their imagination､ which they are forming to-day, ere yet I bring them into the land of which I sware unto their fathers.
content_old: 21 And it shall come to pass when many calamities and misfortunes shall find them out then shall this Song respond to their face､ as a witness, for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouth of their seed, for I know their imagination､ which they are forming to-day, ere yet I bring them into the land of which I sware unto their fathers.

content: 22 Moses therefore wrote this Song on that day,—and taught it unto the sons of Israel.
content_old: 22 Moses therefore wrote this Song on that day,—and taught it unto the sons of Israel.

content: 23 And he commanded Joshua､ son of Nun､ and said— Be firm and bold, for thou shalt bring the sons of Israel into the land which I have sworn to them,—and I will be with thee.
content_old: 23 And he commanded Joshua､ son of Nun､ and said— Be firm and bold, for thou shalt bring the sons of Israel into the land which I have sworn to them,—and I will be with thee.

content: 24 And it came to pass when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law､ upon a scroll,—until he had finished them
content_old: 24 And it came to pass when Moses had made an end of writing the words of this law､ upon a scroll,—until he had finished them

content: 25 then Moses commanded the Levites, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ saying:
content_old: 25 then Moses commanded the Levites, who were bearing the ark of the covenant of Yahweh､ saying:

content: 26 Take this scroll of the law, and put it at the side of the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God,—so shall it be there in thy midst as a witness.
content_old: 26 Take this scroll of the law, and put it at the side of the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God,—so shall it be there in thy midst as a witness.

content: 27 For I know thy perverseness, and thy stiff neck,—lo! while I am yet alive with you to-day ye are quarrelling with Yahweh, and how much more after my death?
content_old: 27 For I know thy perverseness, and thy stiff neck,—lo! while I am yet alive with you to-day ye are quarrelling with Yahweh, and how much more after my death?

content: 28 Call together unto me､ all the elders of your tribes､ and your officers,—and let me speak in their hearing these words, and let me take to witness against them the heavens and the earth.
content_old: 28 Call together unto me､ all the elders of your tribes､ and your officers,—and let me speak in their hearing these words, and let me take to witness against them the heavens and the earth.

content: 29 For I know that after my death ye will break faith, and turn aside out of the way which I have commanded you,—and calamity will befall you､ in the afterpart of the days, because ye will do the thing that is wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ to provoke him with the work of your own hands.
content_old: 29 For I know that after my death ye will break faith, and turn aside out of the way which I have commanded you,—and calamity will befall you､ in the afterpart of the days, because ye will do the thing that is wicked in the eyes of Yahweh､ to provoke him with the work of your own hands.

content: 1 Give ear O ye heavens and I will speak,— And let the earth hear the sayings of my mouth:
content_old: 1 Give ear O ye heavens and I will speak,— And let the earth hear the sayings of my mouth:

content: 2 Let my teaching drop as the rain, Let my speech distil as the dew,— As copious rains on tender grass, As myriad drops on seeding plants.
content_old: 2 Let my teaching drop as the rain, Let my speech distil as the dew,— As copious rains on tender grass, As myriad drops on seeding plants.

content: 3 When the name of Yahweh I proclaim Ascribe ye greatness unto our God:—
content_old: 3 When the name of Yahweh I proclaim Ascribe ye greatness unto our God:—

content: 4 A Rock! faultless his work, For all his ways are just,— A GOD of faithfulness and without perversity, Right and fair is he!
content_old: 4 A Rock! faultless his work, For all his ways are just,— A GOD of faithfulness and without perversity, Right and fair is he!

content: 5 They have broken faith with him to be no son of his—their fault,— A generation twisted and crooked.
content_old: 5 They have broken faith with him to be no son of his—their fault,— A generation twisted and crooked.

content: 6 Is it Yahweh ye thus requite, O impious people and unwise? Is not he thy father who begat thee? He that made thee and established thee?
content_old: 6 Is it Yahweh ye thus requite, O impious people and unwise? Is not he thy father who begat thee? He that made thee and established thee?

content: 7 Remember the days of age-past times, Remark the years of many generations,— Ask thy father and he will tell thee, Thine elders and they will say to thee:—
content_old: 7 Remember the days of age-past times, Remark the years of many generations,— Ask thy father and he will tell thee, Thine elders and they will say to thee:—

content: 8 When the Most High gave inheritances unto the nations, When he spread abroad the sons of Adam He set the bounds of the peoples, According to the number of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 8 When the Most High gave inheritances unto the nations, When he spread abroad the sons of Adam He set the bounds of the peoples, According to the number of the sons of Israel.

content: 9 For Yahweh’s portion is his people,— Jacob his inherited possession.
content_old: 9 For Yahweh’s portion is his people,— Jacob his inherited possession.

content: 10 He met him in a desert land, And in the howling waste of a wilderness,— He encompassed him watched over him, Shielded him as the pupil of his own eye.
content_old: 10 He met him in a desert land, And in the howling waste of a wilderness,— He encompassed him watched over him, Shielded him as the pupil of his own eye.

content: 11 As an eagle stirreth up his nest, Over his young ones fluttereth,— Spreadeth abroad his wings､ taketh one, Beareth it up on his pinions
content_old: 11 As an eagle stirreth up his nest, Over his young ones fluttereth,— Spreadeth abroad his wings､ taketh one, Beareth it up on his pinions

content: 12 Yahweh alone did lead him,— And there was with him no GOD of a stranger.
content_old: 12 Yahweh alone did lead him,— And there was with him no GOD of a stranger.

content: 13 He made him ride on the high places of the land, Caused him to eat the increase of the fields,— And gave him to suck honey out of the cliff, And oil out of the rock of flint:
content_old: 13 He made him ride on the high places of the land, Caused him to eat the increase of the fields,— And gave him to suck honey out of the cliff, And oil out of the rock of flint:

content: 14 Curds of kine and milk of sheep,— With fat of well-fed lambs Yea rams bred in Bashan and he-goats, With the white of the kernels of wheat,— And the blood of the grape thou didst drink as it foamed.
content_old: 14 Curds of kine and milk of sheep,— With fat of well-fed lambs Yea rams bred in Bashan and he-goats, With the white of the kernels of wheat,— And the blood of the grape thou didst drink as it foamed.

content: 15 Then Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: Thou wast fat､ Thou wast thick Thou wast gorged,— So he forsook the God who made him, And treated as foolish his Rock of salvation.
content_old: 15 Then Jeshurun waxed fat, and kicked: Thou wast fat､ Thou wast thick Thou wast gorged,— So he forsook the God who made him, And treated as foolish his Rock of salvation.

content: 16 They moved him to jealousy with foreign gods,— With abominations angered they him:
content_old: 16 They moved him to jealousy with foreign gods,— With abominations angered they him:

content: 17 They sacrificed to mischievous demons to a No-God, Gods whom they knew not,— New ones lately come in, Your fathers never shuddered at them!
content_old: 17 They sacrificed to mischievous demons to a No-God, Gods whom they knew not,— New ones lately come in, Your fathers never shuddered at them!

content: 18 Of the Rock who had begotten thee thou wast unmindful,— And didst forget GOD who had given thee birth.
content_old: 18 Of the Rock who had begotten thee thou wast unmindful,— And didst forget GOD who had given thee birth.

content: 19 When Yahweh saw he derided,— Because his sons and his daughters gave provocation.
content_old: 19 When Yahweh saw he derided,— Because his sons and his daughters gave provocation.

content: 20 So he said:— I will hide my face from them, I will see what will be their hereafter,— For a generation given to intrigue they are, Sons whom there is no trusting;
content_old: 20 So he said:— I will hide my face from them, I will see what will be their hereafter,— For a generation given to intrigue they are, Sons whom there is no trusting;

content: 21 They have moved me to jealousy with a No-GOD, They have angered me with their vanities: I therefore will move them to jealousy with a No-people, With an impious nation will I anger them.
content_old: 21 They have moved me to jealousy with a No-GOD, They have angered me with their vanities: I therefore will move them to jealousy with a No-people, With an impious nation will I anger them.

content: 22 For a fire is kindled in mine anger, And shall burn as far as hades beneath,— And consume the earth with her produce, And set ablaze the foundations of the mountains:
content_old: 22 For a fire is kindled in mine anger, And shall burn as far as hades beneath,— And consume the earth with her produce, And set ablaze the foundations of the mountains:

content: 23 I will heap on them calamities,— Mine arrows will I spend upon them:
content_old: 23 I will heap on them calamities,— Mine arrows will I spend upon them:

content: 24 The meltings of hunger, The devourings of fever, And the dangerous pestilence,— And the tooth of beasts will I send among them, With the poison of crawlers of the dust:
content_old: 24 The meltings of hunger, The devourings of fever, And the dangerous pestilence,— And the tooth of beasts will I send among them, With the poison of crawlers of the dust:

content: 25 Without shall the sword bereave, In the inmost recesses terror,— To both young man and virgin, Suckling､ with man of grey hairs.
content_old: 25 Without shall the sword bereave, In the inmost recesses terror,— To both young man and virgin, Suckling､ with man of grey hairs.

content: 26 I said､ I would puff them away,— I would destroy from mortals their memory;
content_old: 26 I said､ I would puff them away,— I would destroy from mortals their memory;

content: 27 Were it not that the taunt of the foe I feared, Lest their adversaries should mistake,— Lest they should say— Our own hand is exalted, It is not Yahweh therefore who hath wrought all this!
content_old: 27 Were it not that the taunt of the foe I feared, Lest their adversaries should mistake,— Lest they should say— Our own hand is exalted, It is not Yahweh therefore who hath wrought all this!

content: 28 For a nation of vanished sagacity they are,— And there is in them no understanding.
content_old: 28 For a nation of vanished sagacity they are,— And there is in them no understanding.

content: 29 If they had been wise they would have understood this,— They would have given heed to their hereafter!
content_old: 29 If they had been wise they would have understood this,— They would have given heed to their hereafter!

content: 30 Oh! how would one have chased a thousand, And two put ten thousand to flight,— Were it not that their Rock had sold them, And Yahweh had abandoned them;
content_old: 30 Oh! how would one have chased a thousand, And two put ten thousand to flight,— Were it not that their Rock had sold them, And Yahweh had abandoned them;

content: 31 For not like our Rock is their rock,— Our enemies themselves being judges;
content_old: 31 For not like our Rock is their rock,— Our enemies themselves being judges;

content: 32 For of the vine of Sodom is their vine, And of the vineyards of Gomorrah,— Their grapes are grapes of gall, Clusters of bitter things are theirs:
content_old: 32 For of the vine of Sodom is their vine, And of the vineyards of Gomorrah,— Their grapes are grapes of gall, Clusters of bitter things are theirs:

content: 33 The poison of large serpents is their wine,— Yea the fierce venom of asps.
content_old: 33 The poison of large serpents is their wine,— Yea the fierce venom of asps.

content: 34 Is not that stored up with me,— Sealed up amongst my treasures;
content_old: 34 Is not that stored up with me,— Sealed up amongst my treasures;

content: 35 Unto the days of vengeance and requital: Unto the time their foot shall totter? For near is the day of their fate, And their destiny speedeth on.
content_old: 35 Unto the days of vengeance and requital: Unto the time their foot shall totter? For near is the day of their fate, And their destiny speedeth on.

content: 36 For Yahweh will vindicate his people, And upon his servants will have compassion,— When he seeth that strength is exhausted, And there is no one shut up or at large
content_old: 36 For Yahweh will vindicate his people, And upon his servants will have compassion,— When he seeth that strength is exhausted, And there is no one shut up or at large

content: 37 Then will he say Where are their gods, The rock in whom they have trusted;
content_old: 37 Then will he say Where are their gods, The rock in whom they have trusted;

content: 38 Who used to eat the fat of their sacrifices, To drink the wine of their libations? Let them rise up and help you, Let them be over you for a covering!
content_old: 38 Who used to eat the fat of their sacrifices, To drink the wine of their libations? Let them rise up and help you, Let them be over you for a covering!

content: 39 See now that I I am he that is, And there are no gods with me,— I kill—and make alive I wound and I heal, And there is none who from my hand can deliver,
content_old: 39 See now that I I am he that is, And there are no gods with me,— I kill—and make alive I wound and I heal, And there is none who from my hand can deliver,

content: 40 For I lift up unto the heavens my hand,— And say, Living am I unto times age-abiding:
content_old: 40 For I lift up unto the heavens my hand,— And say, Living am I unto times age-abiding:

content: 41 If I whet my flashing sword, And my hand take hold on justice I will return vengeance unto mine adversaries, And them who hate me will I requite:
content_old: 41 If I whet my flashing sword, And my hand take hold on justice I will return vengeance unto mine adversaries, And them who hate me will I requite:

content: 42 I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, And my sword shall devour flesh,— With the blood of the slain and the captive, With the flesh of the chief leader of the foe.
content_old: 42 I will make mine arrows drunk with blood, And my sword shall devour flesh,— With the blood of the slain and the captive, With the flesh of the chief leader of the foe.

content: 43 Shout for joy O ye nations with his people, For the blood of his servants he avengeth,— And vengeance he returneth unto his adversaries, And is propitious unto the soil of his people.
content_old: 43 Shout for joy O ye nations with his people, For the blood of his servants he avengeth,— And vengeance he returneth unto his adversaries, And is propitious unto the soil of his people.

content: 44 So Moses came in and spake all the words of this Song in the hearing of the people,—he and Hoshea son of Nun.
content_old: 44 So Moses came in and spake all the words of this Song in the hearing of the people,—he and Hoshea son of Nun.

content: 45 And when Moses made an end of speaking all these words unto all Israel
content_old: 45 And when Moses made an end of speaking all these words unto all Israel

content: 46 he said unto them— Apply your hearts unto all the words which I am witnessing against you､ to-day,—how that ye must command your sons to observe to do all the words of this law;
content_old: 46 he said unto them— Apply your hearts unto all the words which I am witnessing against you､ to-day,—how that ye must command your sons to observe to do all the words of this law;

content: 47 for it is not too small a thing for you, for it is your life,—and hereby shall ye prolong your days upon the soil whereunto ye are passing over the Jordan to possess it.
content_old: 47 for it is not too small a thing for you, for it is your life,—and hereby shall ye prolong your days upon the soil whereunto ye are passing over the Jordan to possess it.

content: 48 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, on this self-same day､ saying:
content_old: 48 And Yahweh spake unto Moses, on this self-same day､ saying:

content: 49 Get thee up into this mountain of the Abarim､ Mount Nebo､ which is in the land of Moab, which is over against Jericho—and behold the land of Canaan which I am giving unto the sons of Israel､ for a possession;
content_old: 49 Get thee up into this mountain of the Abarim､ Mount Nebo､ which is in the land of Moab, which is over against Jericho—and behold the land of Canaan which I am giving unto the sons of Israel､ for a possession;

content: 50 and die thou in the mount whither thou art going up, and be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk,—as Aaron thy brother died､ in Mount Hor, and was withdrawn unto his kinsfolk;
content_old: 50 and die thou in the mount whither thou art going up, and be withdrawn unto thy kinsfolk,—as Aaron thy brother died､ in Mount Hor, and was withdrawn unto his kinsfolk;

content: 51 for that ye acted unfaithfully against me､ in the midst of the sons of Israel, regarding the waters of Meribah-Kadesh､ in the desert of Zin,—for that ye hallowed me not in the midst of the sons of Israel.
content_old: 51 for that ye acted unfaithfully against me､ in the midst of the sons of Israel, regarding the waters of Meribah-Kadesh､ in the desert of Zin,—for that ye hallowed me not in the midst of the sons of Israel.

content: 1 Now this is the blessing wherewith Moses､ the man of God､ blessed the sons of Israel,—before his death.
content_old: 1 Now this is the blessing wherewith Moses､ the man of God､ blessed the sons of Israel,—before his death.

content: 2 And he said— Yahweh from Sinai came near,— Yea he dawned､ out of Seir､ upon them, He shone forth out of Mount Paran, Yea he came out of holy myriads,— Out of his right hand proceeded fire to guide them.
content_old: 2 And he said— Yahweh from Sinai came near,— Yea he dawned､ out of Seir､ upon them, He shone forth out of Mount Paran, Yea he came out of holy myriads,— Out of his right hand proceeded fire to guide them.

content: 3 Yea he loved the tribes. All his holy ones were in thy hand,— Yea they were encamped at thy feet, Each one bare away some of thy words.
content_old: 3 Yea he loved the tribes. All his holy ones were in thy hand,— Yea they were encamped at thy feet, Each one bare away some of thy words.

content: 4 A law did Moses command us,— A possession for the convocation of Jacob.
content_old: 4 A law did Moses command us,— A possession for the convocation of Jacob.

content: 5 Thus became he in Jeshurun a king,— When the heads of the people gathered themselves together, As one man the tribes of Israel. Reuben—
content_old: 5 Thus became he in Jeshurun a king,— When the heads of the people gathered themselves together, As one man the tribes of Israel. Reuben—

content: 6 Let Reuben live and not die,— Nor his men be easily counted.
content_old: 6 Let Reuben live and not die,— Nor his men be easily counted.

content: 7 And this is for Judah､ when he said, Hear､ O Yahweh､ the voice of Judah, That unto his own people thou wouldst bring him home,— Let his own hands suffice him, And a helper from his adversaries do thou become.
content_old: 7 And this is for Judah､ when he said, Hear､ O Yahweh､ the voice of Judah, That unto his own people thou wouldst bring him home,— Let his own hands suffice him, And a helper from his adversaries do thou become.

content: 8 And of Levi he said: Let thy perfections and thy lights belong unto thy man of lovingkindness,— Whom thou didst put to the proof at Massah, With whom thou didst contend over the waters of Meribah;
content_old: 8 And of Levi he said: Let thy perfections and thy lights belong unto thy man of lovingkindness,— Whom thou didst put to the proof at Massah, With whom thou didst contend over the waters of Meribah;

content: 9 Who saith､ of his father and of his mother､ I behold them not, And his own brethren regardeth he not, And his own sons observeth he not,— Because they watch thy speech, That thy covenant they may preserve;
content_old: 9 Who saith､ of his father and of his mother､ I behold them not, And his own brethren regardeth he not, And his own sons observeth he not,— Because they watch thy speech, That thy covenant they may preserve;

content: 10 May teach thy regulations unto Jacob, And thy law unto Israel,— May put incense in thy nostrils, And a whole-offering upon thine altar.
content_old: 10 May teach thy regulations unto Jacob, And thy law unto Israel,— May put incense in thy nostrils, And a whole-offering upon thine altar.

content: 11 Bless､ O Yahweh､ his substance, And with the work of his hands wilt thou be well pleased,— Crush thou the loins of them who rise up against him､ And of them who hate him､ that they rise not again.
content_old: 11 Bless､ O Yahweh､ his substance, And with the work of his hands wilt thou be well pleased,— Crush thou the loins of them who rise up against him､ And of them who hate him､ that they rise not again.

content: 12 Of Benjamin he said, The beloved of Yahweh shall settle down securely,— With one to throw a shade over him all the day long, Yea between his shoulders hath he found rest.
content_old: 12 Of Benjamin he said, The beloved of Yahweh shall settle down securely,— With one to throw a shade over him all the day long, Yea between his shoulders hath he found rest.

content: 13 And of Joseph he said, Blessed of Yahweh be his land,— With the precious things of the heavens､ with the dew, And with the abyss､ couching beneath;
content_old: 13 And of Joseph he said, Blessed of Yahweh be his land,— With the precious things of the heavens､ with the dew, And with the abyss､ couching beneath;

content: 14 And with the precious fruits of the sun,— And with the precious yield of the moons;
content_old: 14 And with the precious fruits of the sun,— And with the precious yield of the moons;

content: 15 And with the chief of the ancient mountains,— And with the precious things of the age-abiding hills;
content_old: 15 And with the chief of the ancient mountains,— And with the precious things of the age-abiding hills;

content: 16 And with the precious things of the earth and its fulness, And with the goodwill of One who dwelt in a thorn-bush.— Let it come on the head of Joseph, And on the crown of the head of him who was consecrated among his brethren.
content_old: 16 And with the precious things of the earth and its fulness, And with the goodwill of One who dwelt in a thorn-bush.— Let it come on the head of Joseph, And on the crown of the head of him who was consecrated among his brethren.

content: 17 His firstborn ox be an honour to him､ And the horns of a buffalo be his horns, With them let him thrust peoples､ All at once to the ends of the earth,— Yea with these the myriads of Ephraim, And with those the thousands of Manasseh.
content_old: 17 His firstborn ox be an honour to him､ And the horns of a buffalo be his horns, With them let him thrust peoples､ All at once to the ends of the earth,— Yea with these the myriads of Ephraim, And with those the thousands of Manasseh.

content: 18 And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice､ Zebulun､ in thy going out,— And thou Issachar､ in thy tents:
content_old: 18 And of Zebulun he said, Rejoice､ Zebulun､ in thy going out,— And thou Issachar､ in thy tents:

content: 19 The peoples unto the mountain will they call, There will they offer the sacrifices of righteousness,— For the abundance of the seas will they suck, Hidden treasures of the sand.
content_old: 19 The peoples unto the mountain will they call, There will they offer the sacrifices of righteousness,— For the abundance of the seas will they suck, Hidden treasures of the sand.

content: 20 And of Gad he said: Blessed be he that hath made room for Gad,— As a lioness hath he laid himself down, And hath torn an arm､ likewise the crown of the head;
content_old: 20 And of Gad he said: Blessed be he that hath made room for Gad,— As a lioness hath he laid himself down, And hath torn an arm､ likewise the crown of the head;

content: 21 And hath provided a first part for himself, For there a commander’s portion hath been hid,— So he cometh with the heads of the people, The righteousness of Yahweh he executeth, And his regulations､ with Israel.
content_old: 21 And hath provided a first part for himself, For there a commander’s portion hath been hid,— So he cometh with the heads of the people, The righteousness of Yahweh he executeth, And his regulations､ with Israel.

content: 22 And of Dan he said, Dan is a lion’s whelp,— He leapeth out of Bashan.
content_old: 22 And of Dan he said, Dan is a lion’s whelp,— He leapeth out of Bashan.

content: 23 And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali! satisfied with favour, And full with the blessing of Yahweh,— The west and the sunny south do thou possess.
content_old: 23 And of Naphtali he said, O Naphtali! satisfied with favour, And full with the blessing of Yahweh,— The west and the sunny south do thou possess.

content: 24 And of Asher he said, Most blessed of sons be Asher,— Let him have the goodwill of his brethren, And let him dip､ in oil､ his foot:
content_old: 24 And of Asher he said, Most blessed of sons be Asher,— Let him have the goodwill of his brethren, And let him dip､ in oil､ his foot:

content: 25 Iron and bronze be thy sandals, And as thy days be thy strength.
content_old: 25 Iron and bronze be thy sandals, And as thy days be thy strength.

content: 26 There is none like GOD､ O Jeshurun,— Riding upon the heavens to thy help,— And for his own majesty on the skies;
content_old: 26 There is none like GOD､ O Jeshurun,— Riding upon the heavens to thy help,— And for his own majesty on the skies;

content: 27 Above is the God of aforetime, And beneath are the Arms of the ages,— So he driveth before thee the foe､ And doth say— Destroy!
content_old: 27 Above is the God of aforetime, And beneath are the Arms of the ages,— So he driveth before thee the foe､ And doth say— Destroy!

content: 28 Thus hath Israel settled down securely､ Alone the fountain of Jacob, Within a land both of corn and new wine,— His heaven also droppeth down dew.
content_old: 28 Thus hath Israel settled down securely､ Alone the fountain of Jacob, Within a land both of corn and new wine,— His heaven also droppeth down dew.

content: 1 So then Moses went up､ from the waste plains of Moab､ into Mount Nebo, the head of Pisgah, which is over against Jericho,—and Yahweh showed him all the land—even Gilead as far as Dan;
content_old: 1 So then Moses went up､ from the waste plains of Moab､ into Mount Nebo, the head of Pisgah, which is over against Jericho,—and Yahweh showed him all the land—even Gilead as far as Dan;

content: 2 and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh,—and all the land of Judah, as far as the hinder sea;
content_old: 2 and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh,—and all the land of Judah, as far as the hinder sea;

content: 3 and the South,—and the circuit of the valley of Jericho､ the city of palm trees as far as Zoar.
content_old: 3 and the South,—and the circuit of the valley of Jericho､ the city of palm trees as far as Zoar.

content: 4 And Yahweh said unto him— This is the land which I sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob､ saying, Unto thy seed will I give it. I have let thee see with thine own eyes, But thither shalt thou not pass over.
content_old: 4 And Yahweh said unto him— This is the land which I sware to Abraham､ to Isaac､ and to Jacob､ saying, Unto thy seed will I give it. I have let thee see with thine own eyes, But thither shalt thou not pass over.

content: 5 So Moses､ the servant of Yahweh died there､ in the land of Moab､ at the bidding of Yahweh;
content_old: 5 So Moses､ the servant of Yahweh died there､ in the land of Moab､ at the bidding of Yahweh;

content: 6 and he buried him､ in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Beth-peor,—but no man hath known his buryingplace, until this day.
content_old: 6 and he buried him､ in a valley in the land of Moab, over against Beth-peor,—but no man hath known his buryingplace, until this day.

content: 7 Now Moses was a hundred and twenty years old�� when he died,—his eye had not dimmed､ nor had his freshness fled.
content_old: 7 Now Moses was a hundred and twenty years old�� when he died,—his eye had not dimmed､ nor had his freshness fled.

content: 8 And the sons of Israel bewailed Moses in the waste plains of Moab､ thirty days,—then were completed the wailing-days of the mourning for Moses.
content_old: 8 And the sons of Israel bewailed Moses in the waste plains of Moab､ thirty days,—then were completed the wailing-days of the mourning for Moses.

content: 9 But Joshua､ son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands upon him,—so the sons of Israel hearkened unto him､ and did as Yahweh commanded Moses.
content_old: 9 But Joshua､ son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands upon him,—so the sons of Israel hearkened unto him､ and did as Yahweh commanded Moses.

content: 10 And there arose not a prophet any more in Israel､ like unto Moses,—whom Yahweh acknowledged, face to face;
content_old: 10 And there arose not a prophet any more in Israel､ like unto Moses,—whom Yahweh acknowledged, face to face;

content: 11 by all the signs､ and the wonders､ which Yahweh sent him to do､ in the land of Egypt,—unto Pharaoh､ and unto all his servants and unto all his land;
content_old: 11 by all the signs､ and the wonders､ which Yahweh sent him to do､ in the land of Egypt,—unto Pharaoh､ and unto all his servants and unto all his land;
